3iqwzw6H2pZfdIOpNPDOoQ.text: I absolutely love this place!  I've always been a big fan of Mongolian food since living in California. Never thought I would find a chain of Mongolian food with so many sauces to choose from! Definitely worth a try if you like Mongolian food!! My go to for Mongolian food now!

Q8gXTFjXIXalKeXJx42nnQ.text: Pros:  -You get A LOT of food for $13 bucks. There is a size smaller but it's a dollar less, so we felt it made sense to do the dollar more. I should've gone with the small. If you're super hungry, this is the place for you.  -The employees are super friendly! They were more than willing to help with whatever we needed. For that, I increased my rating one star.  - Just like any other Mongolian grill restaurant, you can customize it to suit what you're in the mood for. They have a great selection of veggies and meat. They have a ton of noodles. You can also choose from brown rice or white rice (side note, it is not cooked in with your meal.   Cons:  - I really felt like it was a game of "how high can I pile my noodles." It's a waste of food, in my opinion. And I get it, you can take your leftovers home but most people I saw around me did not.  - While the selection of food was good, it did not taste that great. I had the chicken and beef. The meats were shaved and frozen. It was dry, even though I drenched it with a custom sauce. The soup choices were a veggie beef or a chicken noodle (maybe?). I felt just super confused, as my brain doesn't associate a veggie beef soup or chicken noodle with Mongolian.  - There were a lot of people in the restaurant and the flow of getting your food was a little chaotic. Again, had the employees not been helpful, I probably would've just left. Bc there were so many people, it made getting food difficult and simply messy.   Overall, if you're looking for a massive food experience with super nice employees and don't mind giving up food quality, this is the place for you.

59XqAxeLJOYRxVajErABBg.text: Gotta love YCs! They really do it right! I love that you can pay $1 for a to-go box. Most places like this do not allow you to take your leftovers home, which is pretty wasteful. Also, love the wax papers by the frozen meat so you can smash it down really good, leaving more room for all the fixins.

VaH-OdXpVriKN5HSVfSS2Q.text: I love this place the perfect establishment if your looking for a fresh stir fry with the option to customize it to your liking. The food is great and the customer service is amazing as always! The little guy working at the front counter always puts a smile on my face with his professionalism at such a young age!

bQv8HVl0KYuUgMmMKzFvug.text: YC's has the best possible customer service! I also love the interior design of this location it is outstandingly beautiful!

512AwYCsc5Q0WJ5grJ9gjQ.text: It was my first time ever going to this incredible place. I went in, there was a guy at the front desk and I see him giving a huge bowl and saw them go to the right and take the food by themselves and I was surprised cause I've never been in such place. Important: say "welcome" to every customer! And they did. The first thing I'm lookin when I go to a restaurant is the entrance (small but nice) ., and the second thing is how clean the restaurant and it was quite clean surprisingly in the fact that everyone is eating a huge bowl full of food. Anyway I go to the guy at the front desk, and I told him it is my first time and he smiled a huge smile(like he know what my reaction gonna be) and he explained to me how it goes and I paid the huge bowl and he walk with me in and tell me to fill as manny as I can and give me peace of paper to shrink the food with force to be able to put more(with the paper to not get dirty)and obviously I was shocked in a good way. From there comes the adorable lady that tells me welcome and she's here to help me for the first time, and I was happy. She helped me with the ingredients and everything that I needed, I pot the bowl at the cook area, and the guy over there was nice and cooked very good my food and afterwards every body told me to have a great day which is very important this days in a restaurant. I want to say that it was a great experience and very good customer service, I wold love to go there again and experience more food with them. I will definitely recommend this place and will refer to my friends and family. Thank you.

y3Rh2RQuPExKjQikqsOBnw.text: The ingredients are fresh and the food is delicious. The staff is friendly and professional and Christy is particularly helpful. Great place to eat!

NHEBpkcI_dcvxSRR0q8H8A.text: I often crave YC's. The freshness of all ingredients and the ability to create your own dish and sauce is great.

Wk0yE_PPXuNrGaL08yxqjw.text: I went for Sunday dinner and am sorry to say I was extremely disappointed at the variety of the 'protein' options available to add to my bowl as well as the taste of the food. There were extremely low varieties of the protein options with only processed chicken tasting really bad and no shrimp option at all. The fish was also alaskan cod which was not tasty at all. Given the overall price and rival restaurants in the vicinity serving much better food with better variations and more options at a much competitive price, I would really wish that YC takes note of this in order to make some improvements. Also the defined sauce mix for various spice levels as specified should be revised too to make it tastier as for me even after ordering a mildly spicy sauce mix my bowl tasted totally bland. The only good part of the entire experience was however the nachos which were really good. However I would still like to suggest to work upon the main bowl rather than to increase options in the complimentary sections like the nachos or the drinks or the icecream

PKBzNqaEM5fEtSSargh3xg.text: I've been coming here for years and the food is always amazing. Everything is fresh and cooked right in front of you and you can make a million different combinations. Love YCs!

PI59CwYOuilJbYfLewGlZw.text: Thank goodness for places that are allergy friendly. My fiance was craving something Asian flavored, but finding a place that knows when the sauce has shrimp or oyster sauce in it can be tricky. This place has everything labeled by soy/gluten/fish etc and I didn't have any issues post meal!

iT1CYdwe0WUkzC2B9XmcBw.text: I dined at this restaurant for the first time tonight and I give it 5 stars. Three of the stars can be attributed to employee, Alexa. She was competent and friendly and made our visit very enjoyable. She did a great job showing us the ropes. She was thorough but efficient, mindful of the hungry people in line behind us. Anytime she was not helping patrons, she was tidying up around her or helping her coworkers. Thanks for the excellent service and a pleasant experience.

vHsKEUpEdKMsEcng_-beHQ.text: Excellent food, prepared exactly how YOU want it. Lots of variety of veges and meats, lots of different sauces to try. Separate bowls for food and sauce, so be sure to fill up both. If you leave here hungry, you only have yourself to blame! Don't come here with a bashful appetite, it will be a waste!

Lzoojiu1ST_745jTfP21gA.text: it's a good idea, I can see where people are inundated with too many choices, I know I was, and it felt rushed, and cramped the night I was there.  The food is good.

RFPgfuM7v-RVdR_EDp89Zw.text: I live in Northern Virginia and whenever I visit the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, I make visiting this restaurant a priority.  The food is delicious and very reasonable priced, especially compared to Genghis Grill.  The food and the recipes at YC's are significantly better than Genghis.  I believe for $9.95 (1 big bowl), don't quote me on the price, you get the entree with rice, noodles, soup, drink, and ice cream.  Even it is a dollar more, you will not be disappointed.  Looking forward to my next trip to Phoenix!  06

UQQhQExyLYHiN8mcoRzqKw.text: Came here after a dragon boat race and it was perfect because we were all starving. You can pile up as much meat, vegetables, and noodles as you want and make up your own sauces based on the blackboard they have up. I will say that $11.50 seems like a lot to pay for a bowl, but it was worth it to me since I was stuffed after I miraculously finished my bowl of food.

vOZs3GEBj9g3qERzwyredA.text: This place is AMAZE!! Low key, fast, tasty, and lots of choices.  I usually pile on more meat than veggies and tend to go for the thai chili sauce. WHOA!! If it's your first time there and you have leftovers don't forget to tell the waitress that your new and she will give you the doggie box for free.   I also love that they serve BROWN rice.  Not a lot of asian places do so thanks for that  Mr. YC!!

uXYXVGgyjyzwYp1u7OntEA.text: I love YC's.  I've been eating here for over 10 years.

0OUMW_d7jS_d1T8GqHIsuQ.text: I love YC's! Its really good for the price.

MNawvAfrRl3qFDJ2Wc_ezw.text: YC's? Because!  When I first moved to the Phoenix area, I discovered the most beautiful Mexican-American woman in the world...working at YC's Mongolian Stir Fry. In fact, having sampled several locations in the valley, the owner seems to be fond of hiring the most beautiful Mexican-American women. I don't really care but it is distracting when I eat there twice a day.  If you've never tried Mongolian Stir Fry, basically you put raw ingredients into a bowl, add sauces and it is cooked on a big, hot surface. After a couple of minutes, BING! Lunch and dinner and another lunch, if you know how to "play" the system at YC's.  There are no "going back for seconds," so plan accordingly. You get your bowl and pay $10 (children are charged by age or just get them a small bowl).  Your first step is loading in the meat. Huh-huh! The meats are sliced and frozen. Place a good amount in the bowl and press it down with the papers at the end of the bar. I like to then go to the fry station and load some peanuts in the bowl and put on some hot chili oil. Then I load on assorted vegetables, tofu and noodles. Then I add the sauces. Some locations have "sauce experts" who take a brutal ribbing for having that on the back of their shirts. Imagine a beautiful Mexican-American woman with that on her shirt. It gives you ideas. Impure ideas.  Honestly, the line method is meat, veggies, sauce, then step up to the fry station, add sesame seeds, peanuts, pineapple and/or assorted oils and such and the chef will cook it for you. I do it by jumping around (when there's no line of people behind me) so the sauce sits on the meat (huh-huh!) and isn't all sitting on the noodles. Don't worry about overloading the bowl a mile high of your food choices. It cooks down and the idea is taking stuff home. They actually encourage it (take out boxes are 50, so it's a profit scam...deal).  Add a bowl of all-you-can-eat-and-stuff-into-the-baggies-in-your-pocket rice (white or brown) and soups (always two kinds) and you are in heaven...with beautiful Mexican-American sauce experts! Huh-huh!  Please don't forget to tip the cook a dollar per bowl and leave a couple of bucks for the girls who have to clean up the table...scrubbing and bending. Cleaning up after such a dirty, dirty boy. Mmmmmm-ah!

9bH-fSNsKSnF9GWPm1wB0g.text: When I was the young age of 3, my mom brought me to YC's. I have been going ever since. This place is such a pleasant change from all the typical restaurants where you sit down, order from a set menu, and then get served your meal. Here you get to branch out and build your own Mongolian stir-fry from a huge selection of raw ingredients from the buffet style food line. There's meat, tons of vegetable selections, other toppings, and various types of noodles to add. But the personalization doesn't stop there. You then get to create your own sauce either on your own or using any of YC's own personal recipes. At this point, you hand over your bowl to one of their "grill warriors" and watch them bring your stir-fry to life on the giant grills. The finished product always is perfectly cooked, has epic taste and flavor because it has EXACTLY what you want, and keeps you coming back! YC's also has crispy wontons, rice, and chopsticks (of course) to complete the meal! This is a place I will never get tired of because the possibilities are endless. Their facility is always clean and staff is welcoming and helpful. Not to mention, it is very affordable. I highly recommend everyone to "mongo" at YC's Mongolian Grill!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. YC&#39;s never fails! It is such an experience to make your own stir-fry and watch their &#34;grill warriors&#34; cook it to perfection!

_tx6Iau3GqhUS8QcCcqk1Q.text: I never get tired of this place. I always enjoy my meal and you can always leave full, no matter how hungry you are when you come in.

0XF10z9fNcRizpFOkQ8nTg.text: First time visiting YC's on a recommendation from my daughter. I really really liked it because I could make my own bowl of whatever it is I wanted in there. The meat selection looked weird because its very thin shaved meat but I can do without the meat. The variety of sauces was great and you can even come up with your own sauce. The young lady at the counter was very nice and helpful after I told her that it was our 1st time there. She walked us thru the whole build our bowl process and even helped with our sauce selection. Without her help we would have been lost. We will definitely come back

iDXoB7GqmqAD2XnW45cIHQ.text: I LOVE,LOVE, LOVE YC's.  I come from the midwest where we have HuHot's and its an all-you-can-eat, go up as many times as you want kinda place so I was a little weary when my friend said you only can go through once with your semi-small bowl.  Then she showed me the way with the packing papers and I must say I have become quite a pro at making monster stir-frys that last 2-3 meals worth.   I love YC's because: -Great selection of veggies, amazing selection of sauces and most are very low calorie.   -Extremely quick cooking time w/ friendly service -I love the whole grain options for noodles and brown rice. -I love that you get soup, wontons, rice, and drinks with your meal price.    Could improve with more protein selections, like seafood.  Not a big deal though.  I have gone here nearly once a week every since I first went here.  Its a great fast lunch place.  Every other mongolian grill place I've been to in the valley has not come close to comparing.

Var3SAYYmwTo1bOrPZ0a-Q.text: I updated my review because I was at Mongolian Grill for the second time and they have improve a lot, the food, the service and everything was much better than the first time I visited the restaurant. Is why I`m giving 5 stars because I`m happy with all the service improvement and the food was good and well cook.

Y2dOGzMaHU-a1j_SrTtEbw.text: I had a negative experience with this place first time I went. I yelped about it and the owner was nice and professional enough to respond to my Yelp! He sent me a free lunch/dinner voucher for two people. I went again and had a positive experience. The quantity of food for the price is amazing (will last at least 2-3 meals). Pretty good stir fry as well! More than anything, I was amazed with how understanding the owner was and would recommend this place for service!

1rliYfPu1imG0ebfJaqKmw.text: We went here on Valentines Day for a girls night out (being single doesn't mean you have to be miserable!), it was my first time at a YC's! Another friend of mine went to the one on Elliot, and she raved about it to me. I completely forgot until we went here on the 14th!  We arrived before they closed, what's nice is that they let you eat your fill if you don't pull a dick move and arrive at 8:45pm to eat with a large group. I'm not a big fan of buffets, after visiting one with my family in California, I became completely discouraged with the rampant shouting kids, claustrophobic tables and chairs that made you turn sideways to walk down isle, and some of us ended up with food poisoning since the waiters weren't keeping the place clean - but YC's has given me a good outlook on family sit-down buffets. At least, arrive after 8pm so parents have to take the kids home for bed on a weekday haha!  After paying we walked down the line, a lot of people were piling it up, my friend helped me figure it out which was really simple. The girl at the cash register was nice also and helped with the instructions on how to get the food.  One thing I really loved about YC's was that above the area where they fry your food up, there is a huge chalkboard on all the different Asian sauce mixes you can have for your dish! I ended up making Curry-yaki, and it was REALLY good, it reminded me of eating in a Japanese food court while in California!  YC's is a clean place, not loud and obnoxious after 8pm on a weekday, and people are polite while you're waiting for your food in line. I want to try this place out again so you can count on me coming back!!!

xrrWoyZRyGct1hcDFHgYNg.text: Everyone seems to have their own opinions about the sauce combinations. Not matter what combination of sauces I use it ALWAYS tastes the same. I have taken bites out of everybody's bowl at my table (with permission, or at least warning), all pretty much the same. Not a bad thing, just tastes like YC's. Other than that, all seems to have been said in the other 90 reviews  Go for lunch, fill up on wontons and soup while you're there, pony up $.50 for the ToGo Box and you get three good meals for $10. (But I do remember when I could ditch class at SCC and hit up that location for lunch for $5, but then again you could get a pack of smokes at that Chevron for just over $3 back then as well. Inflation sucks, YC's doesn't, Man I'm old)

7MCGJpHLQg3YpU9TfzMz0g.text: I gave this place 5 stars because it is as good as it gets for Mongolian BBQ. This place has lots of great items to choose from to put in your bowl. Great sauce/seasoning items, and a recipe board if you don't feel like winging it. You get steamed white or brown rice, wonton soup, and my favorite, fried crunchy noodles with sweet & sour sauce for dipping. And if you didn't stuff your face enough on noodles, rice, and soup, they have self serve ice cream too. The only thing that sucks is that if you don't finish your food, which you probably won't, they charge you $0.50 for a to-go box. Great leftovers though. You can throw it in a pan and it's almost better than the first time.   My kids love it because they can put whatever they want or don't want in their food, and they eat it all up!

33A0WoEOg6lb1TZLfZzsJw.text: The only bad thing about this place is that it's not in Chicago. Absolutely fell in love with this restaurant when visiting my sis. Great veriaty of sauces and veggies. It's the first thing that comes to mind when I think of AZ, outside of my sister of course.

WrE09IPehpm-jLUgZYn47A.text: This is one of my top places to eat any time of the year.  I've been visiting YC's since the late 90's and will continue to dine here.  Even though this is a self service based restaurant, the customer service is always tops.  The cashier is always pleasant and the cooks/grillers are always attentive.  The buffet style line to select your ingredients used to be single file one line.  A few  years back they expanded to two lines and two grills; very helpful on weekend nights with ASU in session.  The food selections and sauces are consistent and tasty.  The diner/fast food style seating is just fine with me, we always choose a booth.    Not sure if this location is still owned by the body building man who was always checking our tables for satisfaction, but either way this is one of the staples of our diet.

SEHLsL4IUDEyTpBvMjjwRA.text: I love love love YC's.  Where else can I fill a bowl with massive amounts of meat and veggies for like $9?    I went here tonight with my wife and another friend.  It was about 6:30 and it wasn't that busy so that was nice.  It didn't take long for me to fill up my bowl with goodies to the brim and drown it in sauce.  I did mess up a bit with the sauce because it didn't turn out as spicy or as flavorful as I would have liked but it was still great.  In my opinion I don't come here nearly enough.  I probably only say that though because I purposely didn't view their nutritional info so I'm convinced it is relatively healthy.  I mean its not fried fast food stuff, right?  Anyway I love eating here.  The food is great for what it is, the price is right and the service is very good.  Plus I always have leftovers for lunch the next day.  Oh...and the frozen yogurt is garbage.

_UgeegexpRYLNd6JcVCChA.text: Our new favorite Mongolian grill restaurant! This place was reasonably priced. The ingredients were all fresh and continuously maintained. The only oddity in the food line was the tomatoes... the slices are ENORMOUS!!  Seriously, they're 3-4 times larger than what you'll find at other Mongolian places. I have no idea why. I can't imagine anyone wants to eat that large of a bite.  The hostess was very knowledgeable regarding food allergies. They even provide a special tag to let the employees and cooks know when they need to take cross-contamination preventive measures.  Their selection of sauces is wider than most other Mongolian places we've been. They also have a good variety of dry seasonings that really added noticeable flavorings.   I'll officially plant my request to open a location or two along the I-17 corridor!

vzQM64q1kPV_idCMWsdIYA.text: Definitely get the small bowl, even if you think you need the large bowl! They provide you with wax paper so that you can literally pack your raw ingredients into that bowl and top it off with even more food. You'll end up with a bigger plate of food than you anticipate!  The raw ingredients looked very fresh even though we came at the end of the day. However, the sauces weren't very good, which ruined a few of our bowls.

v83Yro2EKkVkLiZ_ZrFO4Q.text: I am sooo loving this place...   as said in previous reviews!!! Now. I invited a couple of friends out to dinner as they have not ever eaten here  I walked them thru the line and sauced, took our try over to the cook etc..  we all had something different!! I believe I could eat here everyday for a year and Never eat the same thing twice. So our friends enjoyed the food and the Peoe/ customers!! They were In hysterics   We watched one man have a large dinner bowl piled soooooo high, he actually got 3 to go containers!!  And we watched az two guys had r large bowls each and ate with chopsticks.. we were all dying as we laughed so hard.  The food is always so fresh and so many options!@ Keep up the good work!!  Ty

v62Hj_DbUe7W7fORifqhhA.text: Twice a month veggie feast with spicy curry!  Cravings! Get s large and save half for lunch tomorrow! Great to go and easy to pack your bowl the way you like !

v6sfP-9s-Li1cyJFz5qdRQ.text: Foods good. Cool little spot. Offers endless drinks, rice, soup, and ice cream with all orders which is nice. You start with ordering a small, large, or endless bowl, at a decent starting price of around $13 for the small, which you fill up at the buffet style ingredients bar, which offers an assortment of Asian ingredients, and your able to pack the ingredients down in the bowl to make room for more food. At the end of the buffet line sauces await with instructions to flavor your bowl with many different Mongolian flavors (I had the Mongolian beef and it was pretty good, but I needed to add a lot soy sauce). After filling up on sauce, you hand your bowls over to the chefs, who cook your food right in front of you on an open circular Mongolian grill (it's cool). Staff was excellent and attentive and help new comers with any questions.

qha4MUjVyuNZGghklo3Buw.text: So, I've been visiting Mongolian BBQ's for 35+ years.  I was excited to visit YC's.  Last night, I get there, the staff was attentive.  Suggested some blends of sauces to make my food more flavorful and gave me a HUGE bowl of blended sauces.  I get up to the grill, the cook places my food on the grill, pours on my sauce, then proceeds to dump a pitcher full of water on it and washed all of my sauce away.  It was the most UN-FLAVORFUL experience I've ever had at an Asian restaurant.    I HIGHLY DOUBT  that after spending $16 for the meal that I'll ever return to one of the YC's locations.  WHY ON EARTH WOULD THE COOK DO THAT ????  WHAT A WASTE OF MY MONEY !

Hjf-MRnbE4d3rwuHYvio2g.text: JENNAH is BOMB.COM she offered to make my sauce and I was very pleased with how it turned out!! Super friendly and always made sure to check to see if we needed anything!! Love this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chef&#39;s Favorite

7qHq1dIlDq84Hr6ashVZNQ.text: If I had kids, I would bring them here- they have a great kids meal deal. Overall, a good casual spot if you want to DIY something. If you avoid carbs and dairy, this has a lot of options. It's also easy to be vegetarian.  Staff were super friendly and helpful.  I felt the price was reasonable- get a big bowl and take (at least) half of it home with you. I didn't even have space for the soup. I liked that drinks were included and their tea selection was pretty good.  For actual food quality, it's about what you would expect for a place like this. You have to know how you want your ingredients sauced. I was really disappointed there was no teriyaki. There are fewer sauce options than at most similar places.  In short, not a place for a super gourmet experience, but not bad, especially if you want Asian-esque flavors without carb-based dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. House sauce with hot chili oil, pork, veggies, and rice noodles

zM3Xp-cJGHY-Q1jzu2miPQ.text: Had not been here in years but stopped in tonight and had a great experience. You forget just how much bang for your buck you get. Food is always good. And I had a great experience thanks to the employees. One of the workers Jenna was super friendly she helped me make a delish sauce . she checked back to see how everything was she was friendly with all the customers , that kind of service and attitude is what will bring me back for sure .

BHjEqAQdjOdN-X9VM__xHQ.text: Every time I come to the East valley I try to make it a point to have lunch at YC. There are other locations in the valley but they are not the same or come close. The staff and layout at Yc is what make me keep coming back and the fact that the  taste is better to me then the competitor. I wish they would put some locations in the west valley or a little more central.

_NXUt6w5rWBMOUgBcI2GZg.text: LOVED this YC's! Jenna was an absolute sweetheart and was so helpful in getting my husband and I's sauces and everything together. She had great recommendations and was super attentive!! Will be back next week!

u_z0d7_AjgPvGa9GAFWoqw.text: YC's is one of those gems where the food is as good as YOU make it. As with many Mongolian BBQ restaurants the main appeal is packing as much protein and vegetables as you can into a small bowl and getting to watch chefs cook it on a large hot plate.   Whenever I go here I always bring friends so they can join in the fun. I've tried to show them how much stuff you can pack in with the wax paper but some are more into packing than others.   I enjoy YC's wide selection of ingredients and sauces. With some many choices you could make hundreds of different combinations. This is especially relevant in the sauce section because of how the different flavors available to mix and match. Above the stoves there are lists of sauce recipes that you can try if you want a specific taste, or you can be like me and just go nuts with what sounds good.   One important rule to note is that only what is in the bowl is going to be cooked. If anything falls on your plastic tray it's not going to be included. So be strategic with your stacking.

lWATNwH130CM2K3eHSgymQ.text: This is probably gonna be my favorite place to eat but the noodles were hella thick, haha!

sOH_bhlzL7r1L8gcZwEsBA.text: Went to dinner here for the second time... and again, it was fantastic!  Today was "move-in" day into the dorms for my ASU freshman son.  After a long day, I took my son, his roommate and his mom, along with my upperclassman son to dinner.  We were greeted by our friendly and knowledgeable host, Maria, who also helped us create our specialty sauces.  All the meats and vegetables were all very fresh!  The variety was impressive! Each of us created our yummy dishes and still had leftovers to take home.  The tables were clean and the staff did a great job checking in on us. Did I mention they even had soft served ice cream for desert? We will definitely be back again! Very reasonably priced, a great value, delicious fresh ingredients... and a friendly staff.  Forget the other Mongolian Grills... just go here.  I know my college boys and I will be coming back again... and often!

ESP1c7N3aDyAwje3uvbFSQ.text: This is my spot when I am extremely hungry, want something quick but still sit down, and want something with noodles. I went here for about 3 years of my 4 years living in Arizona and it never seemed to disappoint. The service is always fast, and friendly so it made me come back. The food is awesome and the sauce mixing is interesting because you can really become very creative with what you choose as your ingredients to add to make your sauce.  I find the food here to have a lot of flavor, the sauces unique, and the setting inside is a standard set up with booths/ dinning tables around the restaurant. If you are looking for something a little more formal this is not the spot to-go but for a quicker bite on a budget but hungry it is perfect. The price is appealing, the food is excellent, the set up is casual so it is hard for me to say anything negative. It is one of the places I truly miss now that I am no longer in Arizona!

QbAT0vsfR9dSHpK8cpimCw.text: As a first timer I was quite surprised as to the friendly service offered!  A pretty young lady greeted us at the door.  She took us to the big row of food ingredients, gave us trays and explained  how and why to use certain ingredients.  It's a help yourself to the ingredients and then we will cook it for you on 2 very large round grills.  We put all sorts of proteins like beef, pork, chicken and cod fish in our metal mixing bowls, either small or large, and there are 2 prices, 12$ or 13$ posted for each.  Then a huge variety of veggies like bean sprouts, celery, onions, green onions, broccoli. potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, green and red peppers, a variety of greens like kale and spinach, mushrooms, and cubes of tofu, at least 3 different kinds of noodles and I probably didn't list them all!  Then comes the sauce station with at least 15-20 different sauces, from hot to spicy to tart to sweet to concentrated beef soup and peanuts.  This same girl helped us decide which sauces to choose, and we ladled them into a small metal bowl.  Last stop in the line was where the cooking grills were, some 5 to 6 feet wide and a chef with a 4 foot spatula mixed and tossed the contents of your bowl plus the liquid sauces creating steam and frying sounds, quite exciting I must say!  You get to go through this line only once.  Next station has unlimited trips and had fried chips, 2 kinds of soup, 3 kinds of rice, and several concentrated sauces like sweet and sour.  At this point you have a gigantic steaming bowl of food which had been transferred to a very large black plastic bowl plus a few little cups of concentrated sauce, and a cup of rice and a cup of soup!.  There were 5 kinds of tea plus the usual soft drinks next in line. At this point you begin shaking due to your low blood sugar level and enchanted experience and fragrances, plus the shear number of vessels and their combined weight!  Oh, did I mention the soft serve ice creams, with cups or cones?   The meal tasted only as good as the chosen ingredients.  I believe you would have to come several times before you get a great combination, hence the possibility of you not returning, as was my thought.  For me it was a nice one time experience.  I would rather use a menu, and let them do "the heavy lifting". The lovely woman we met at the front door continued to help us, with a smile, a good bye greeting and even held the door open for us!!!  I wish I knew her name.

vnaW-KtYgSvQWB8u9JbEHQ.text: Hungry from hiking. Yelped up a dinner spot and OH BOY! Fast, super friendly people, great line up of chicken, beef, chicken, fish and Shrimp, big portions, good prices!! All inclusive ! Hello Arizona Mongols!

2FuDbkjK1Ji4voIXJkodyQ.text: Whew it's been a hot minute since I've been to YC's. I was in the area and had some time to kill before meeting a friend for tea so I stopped in. The entrance was a bit backed up with how many people were in line, but it moved quickly and the woman working at the register was quick and efficient at ringing up orders. Then manager was also great about going around and making sure everyone was doing well and ringing up customers too.  I got a small dinner bowl, which also includes a drink, soup, rice, and froyo. I tried to master the art of piling high into my bowl and think I did an okay job. I got Alaskan cod and tofu for my proteins and added veggies, different noodles, and one of their sauce creations from their menu. If I would've read the menu more clearly, I would've added shrimp and an egg (additional costs). Before your food goes on the grill, the cooks scrape it off and add fresh oil. I added raw peanuts on top for a nice crunch. Everything was hot and delicious but unfortunately I was strapped for time so I bought a to-go box for $.50. Leftover YC's isn't as tasty so I recommend eating as much as you can while it's fresh. And I also wouldn't get the red potatoes or cod again, they didn't jive with the rest of the ingredients.   All in all, I'm glad I came back here and it's good to see that they still offer a healthy serving of food for a decent price, unlike another Mongolian grill chain. No hate, but you gotta stay loyal to the OG.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. The art of piling high
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

itaN7OIXS78zWnqoAJgOYA.text: I have been going to yc's for years and the experience is always the same.  I would like to compliment the chef (me) about choosing such perfect fresh ingredients into my stir fry bowl.  The sauce was exactly what I wanted since I was the one who made it.    The service is always great and the place is clean.  Perfect for lunch or dinner!

V5cWIQzXn9FgpIg6V2rQ-g.text: Very good place to "build" the food the way you want. The price is fair and the vegetables look like fresh.

tWupV-hujrGbAQc59RlKkw.text: Good Mongolian BBQ place albeit on the pricey side at dinner. Lots of add in options as well as sauces to choose from.  Soup and rice could use a little work as well as the desserts. The place is kept clean and the staff is friendly.

50DeoG3QgD09E8mvrtg4gA.text: Went here for the first time today and left a very happy and full customer! I will definitely be back. I wasn't sure how it all worked as far as getting food and other things but their staff was very friendly and more than happy to help. There food is extremely tasty compared to other Mongolian food restaurants that I have been to. I ordered the large bowl and what a mistake that was, in the best way possible! So much food for such a great price! I will definitely come back here! :)

OD1FeaYBKtRyQpT29J1CuA.text: Great food and tons of it. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They showed us how to pack the stuff in our bowl down with tissue paper so we could get even more.

kABAAEeP9jT6Kp9QoGRjSg.text: With its drab exterior and tinted windows, it's only natural to think that YC's is closed. But this is a dining experience you don't want to miss. Once inside, you are met with a charming, buffet-styled line of meats/fish, veggies, and sauce followed immediately by two large grills where your food is cooked in front of you. Portion sizes are as big or small as you make them, but YC's encourages "packing" your bowl to maximize value.  If you're a YC's virgin, feel free to follow one of the sauce recipes written in chalk above the grilling area. They are well-proportioned and achieve the intended style. But make no mistake: improvising with various combinations and proportions on your own is what YC's is all about. You are not here to order food; you are here to design it.   If you are visiting the East Valley and want a unique, hands-on dining experience, YC's Mongolian Grill is a fun and challenging option. It does one thing, and it does it well! Two minor complaints: there is no option to buy a small bowl during dinner hours; and, take-out bags cost an additional $0.50.

ntYQTcRXh80Xi1qmQoYLxQ.text: If you don't love YC's then we can't be friends.

P8_TG7dRiahaf0ZQz3O4Iw.text: Went to YC's yesterday for my first time and let me say... WHY HAVE I NEVER BEEN  HERE BEFORE! Such a cool concept, such a bargain, good quality food. I am a vegetarian and got the tofu which was very good. The reason I really wanted to write this review was because for a fast-casual place the service was honestly amazing. The girls working the register had better customer service than some 5 star restaurants I have been to! They were so excited it was my first time and literally walked me down the "buffet" line explaining everything to me, came over to my table to ask me how I liked it and were honestly just the sweetest girls ever. Customer service goes a long way and the staff at this restaurant deserves some praise.

8INN1NoxgebhMkhzyV8Rcg.text: Love the build your own style here! It's a great place to go with friends and pack your bowl full of delicious food... And you can make it overflowing! Always left overs so make sure you get the .50 doggie bag to take home.

VnAFal2gQhGpLmZsmWo3pw.text: The food is always fresh and you are able to make the selections You desirel! Staff is always friendly and helpful!!

2LpYxG-lSGAb5_jOAPQPRQ.text: Fantastic food.  There is an art to making the perfect dish: just copy the person in front of you and adjust to your taste preferences.  Making the right sauce is key.  There are several YC's across the valley but this one is the best.

VrqiWjMOUEjTWHL9Tlfmvg.text: WOW this place is awesome!!!!!!  Good Healthy choices.  Cooked up exactly the way I want it with ingredients I pick and choose from!!! We will be regulars at this place from now on ( and we won't have to break the bank to go often).

Ws2HHxfU0Kl7QwprgvRGDQ.text: This place is GREAT. I already left Tempe to go back to California, this was my last meal. When I do come back, I am definitely gonna come visit this place. I basically paid $9.50 for two meals! Though I was gonna board an airplane so I didn't wanna take any to go, so I finished it all :].  At first I was feeling a little uncomfortable, not really sure how to work this thing. It was my first time having this style of cuisine where I add my own ingredients. I read up on some reviews first and tried to get a glimpse of it, but watching those around me also helped. The wax paper is there for you to pack your ingredients in and make your money's worth. Great ingredients, fresh and healthy, then at the end you pick wheat noodles and/or rice noodles, I got both, and then you add a combination of any of the sauces you like. My bowl was towering 4 inches over the top with noodles, but some people were obviously even better at it with a bigger pile of noodles. There were a lot of yummy sounding sauces.. But I picked Spicy thai and thai peanut curry, mainly because those were the closest to me and were the least full (meaning someone had to have taken a lot, right?). I only got like 4.5 spoons of sauce, I definitely should have had more, maybe 7, it was pretty dry and I didn't have a pool of sauce at the bottom of my bowl like my brother did.   Keep waiting in line, and then when the chef calls you up, you just present your tray to them and they'll throw it on and cook it. There were also pineapple slices, peanuts, jalapenos, and such, but like i said, it was my first time and I get a bit uncomfortable at serve your self places, because I'm not entirely sure what I'm entitled to. Takes a quick 1-3 minutes to cook all your stuff, grab a table, or add some stuff to your tray.  They have self serve (all you can eat) brown or white rice, 2 choices of soup, which were pretty good, and some tortillas to add to your dish, which was a delightful addition. Also included in your $9.50 is a cup for soda/juice/tea, they even have blue powerade! My favorite, since I don't drink soda :). No tax so just throw a $10 at the host and you're good to go!. You can also tip the cooks if you'd like. Some people upgrade to the large, create a HUGE BOWL, and just take some to go. If you ask for it to go, the chef can easily fit a "small" into two chinese take out boxes. Imagine what a large could be fitted in.   The meal was DELICIOUS, I was STUFFED, however the brown rice could have been a little better, but other than that, I love this place and I can't wait to come back. Healthy eat for sure!

I3m8dwCjRmHuUYNTuNk5CQ.text: Tried this place for the first time this weekend!! Loved it:) will be back! Next time I will def add extra sauces though. Yum!!

UtlmwDtHF7WjqK4YaP3sUA.text: Lets just say that this place was like home to me for 4 years when I was in COLLEGE. The food is great and if you pack the bowl high enough it will last you for days. Five stars aren't enough. The only negative thing I have to say is, WHY ISN'T THERE A YC'S IN CHICAGO YET?

0bfShFZMDeU2LkrPMUn-Zg.text: I know why they don't have one of these in California. F'reals... if they opened this up, UCSD asian-ness would be all over it in a crazy eating frenzy.   Came here with UCSD dragon boat team before a race day and heck, we were ready to stuff our faces! This place makes Khan's Mongolian Grill in UTC look like trash.  Instead of yelling at you for piling on too many meat (or veggies if that's your thang), this place ENCOURAGES it! Yeah! Plus, you can opt for one massive bowl or if you're a crazy big eater, you can opt for unlimited bowls. YC must stand for "You Crazzzzzzzy" if you eat that much. Only downside here is that all the sauces kind of taste the same after a while.  If that's not enough for your stomach to explode, there's endless soup, chips, rice, drinks, and frozen yogurt for you to gorge on.   They take all your needs into account... including a plunger in each stall of the bathroom. Awesome!!

WRbk9mn0ckCOAQBCBe7cyw.text: Best place to eat Mongolian grill food...you can load up a bowl, have them cook it as long as you want, and it is always delicious, cheap, and super super filling.  I love to gorge myself at this place.  The location in Gilbert and the one in Scottsdale are both excellent as well.  The place is always spot-on delicious!!

d2op6XUXV91NQdtkF4YE5Q.text: Good food. Friendly. Loads of variety. Not much more costly than McDonald's.  Sure they use thin sliced frozen meat. But overall the ingredients are quality, the price is right and the taste.. That's is as good as you make it by how you mix your fix. They charge .50 for a to go box which is lame, but they didn't charge me when I needed them for the kids. Young man managing the place is very attentive.   Go and enjoy..

1qpnRo8oicGpVH2RJaDy9g.text: Great place to eat when you're really hungry. I'm a big guy and a small bowl packed is plenty of food. You feel like you're eating healthy but the sodium content is really high so don't be too fooled.

Sdgo65OfbQI8pmRg4_SMSw.text: One of my favorite restaurants!  I went here often in college, and I used to be able to get three meals out of it - order a large bowl and a doggy bag.  I love being able to make my own sauce, with lots of garlic, and dont' forget to SQUISH the meat into the bowl!

v1nf2iJHa1O6qMF4aKfe-Q.text: YC's Mongolian Grill has several locations around the Phoenix area.  A visit to YC's is a unique experience and is different than anywhere I have been.  Here's how the unique process works; 1. Pick either a small or large bowl. The large bowl is only $1 more, but the small bowl is usually more than enough food if packed correctly.  2. Pack your bowl with a selection of raw and frozen meat. You can choose any combination of turkey, chicken, beef, and pork.  3. Cover your frozen meat with wax paper, and smash it down to create space for the remaining ingredients.  4. Pack the remainder of your bowl with fresh vegetables and noodles. Make sure to smash the ingredients as you go to create more space.  5. Create your own sauce to top off the bowl. They have a chalk board with sauce recipes to guide you in making the perfect concoction.  6. Hand your bowl over to one of the chefs and watch them cook it in front of you.   7. Head on over to their rice and condiment bar.  8. Soft drinks are included in the price of your bowl.  At night time they have a frozen yogurt bar that is also included in the price of your bowl.  Great food, unique experience, and a good value gives YC's an above average rating of four stars.

1VykRWjhBUuBHarLnP8gSg.text: I love this place.  I probably eat here more than I do at home, really.  I prefer white meat chicken at lunch / fish at dinner, sprouts, broccoli, carrots, mushrooms, white and green onions, baby corn, and noodles.  I make my own sauce (same one for about 15 years now) using yc's own, spicy hunan, ginger, garlic, and chili oil.  Then they grill it up and serve it hot. I like to add fresh cilantro, jalapenos, and peanuts after they finish cooking it..  They have really nice spicy beef soup.  I wash it down with a iced tea.  Its a guilt free meal really, great staff, locally owned, clean place that I highly recommend.  I go to all the locations, but this one most often.

s9zlIIX2jl-hWYx3UYwi6g.text: Maria was so kind her customer service is outstanding I love how she assisted me in making the right sauce and even after adding WAY too much spice and regretting it she allowed me to remake my bowl  will definitely be back to this location thank you so much!

Re751-xBZ4YMbdzBSwJBOA.text: I've been here a few times but always prefer Genghis. YC's is a place where you get to make your own stir fry. Compared to Genghis, you will get way bigger portions which is definitely a plus. Also, they offer rice and other things for sides in addition to your bowl. I don't know if I just don't get the right sauce or what... I like things saucy. Whether it be wings or anything really that requires sauce. It needs to be super saucy. This applies to my stir fry. Whenever I use their sauces, it seems that the sauce is super thin and just not as tasty as Genghis. :( It is possible that I just haven't put the right ingredients together, though. Maybe someday I'll try it one more time to see if I get it right.

-MFJIfCq9gwpkJY1iCu8fQ.text: Your meal is what ever you make of it, so make it a good one.  Ok so I stole that line from back to the future but it is True. Imagine a salad bar but with raw Asian food ingredient with  cook at the end. One big pro about this style is that you can get just what you want. I for example do not eat meat. YC's allows me to cram as many veggies, noodles and tofu into a bowl as humanly possible. For me it has become a game, how many bowls can I fill post cooking. My current record is three. I can give you bowl construction tips if you would like. If it is not in the bowl it will not be cooked.  The sauces play a big role in the flavor of your meal. If you ask they will let you take a separate bowl for sauce and even help you mix. I like to make my own with generous amounts of garlic and hunan sauce. If you do like garlic like I do be sure to ladle garlic from the bottom of the container as that is where the real pieces are.   After you leave the cooking line you can augment your food with fried won ton strips, spicy oils, mustard's, peanuts, fresh cilantro, sesame seeds, pineapple and more. There also is a station with rice and soups for those who require more than just a bowl of Asian goodness. Soda is included with the meal price and for dinner so is access to the frozen yogurt machine.   If you can not finish your meal they will gladly sell you to go boxes at .50 a piece.    The one thing that confuses me is the name, Mongolians are a nomadic people, yet their BBQ grills are huge I don't see how that would work.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. My record 3 bowls.

rAp8Oa-cd0O3_40izJ17lw.text: Great place for Mongolian bbq. Pick the meat, noodles, veggies, & sauces. Fill your bowl over the top & watch them cook it. White & brown rice, 2 types of soup & wonton chips. You can get at least 2 meals out of it if you set it up right

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cooking it up

LQs6X4tQr9qLQHLn2CGS1g.text: Good food , build your own . Sauces are good , portions are great ( if you can stack it lol )

vtDiKC2NOIkzouVkZ-z5PA.text: I love this place!!! The staff is always very kind and helpful, the food is fresh, and I love the options and flavors they have. The way they price for children is PERFECT (.55 for year year of age) Also, you can't beat that you also get soup, rice, a drink and ice cream with your dinner.

f-ff3KQbRue4Wy1tTpf4OA.text: Stepped out side of my comfort zone and tried this with my daughter, I must say it was a pleasant Suprise, great food and very affordable, cooked to order tight in front of you. Will be back

qJVDOlzt0bWmV_D0PDDJlA.text: Our first time, and we felt very welcomed!  Kristen was so helpful, she went above and beyond!  Perfect spot to take a College student...the leftovers will be welcomed!  Liked all the choices, and that everything was covered in the price!

CgtIxyktLi6GlEdG99GHHQ.text: I love YC's and have been to this location several times. The fixings are always fresh and well stocked, I love the fact that you can choose from different type of noodles. I only wish that there was a way to make your sauce a little saucier. The wok looks scalding hot and they have to add water to your food to prevent from burning, this makes stir-fry flavorful but a bit dry (not enough sauce for my taste). Everybody that works there is super helpful and friendly, too.

ngPNGY3BPE4X8ekqrnByvA.text: I hate giving this place such a poor review, but over all, I wasn't all that impressed.  I came here last night for dinner for the first time, and I can't say that I'm really interested in going back any time soon.  I was hungry, and wanted something different then the usual. I've driven by this place a zillion times, and figured I'd give it a try.  I went in and paid the $11.50 for a plate of food, and I really didn't like it all that much.  I built my own dish, but the meat looked really weird, and the bowls that you put it in were somewhat small.  The selection was meat, pork, chicken and fish. I went with the meat.  I topped it with a few veggies, some sauces, and the cook threw it on the grill. It came out fine, but the meat was just weird.  It was shaved, and was kinda tough.  Veggies and toppings were fresh, but limited.  More salad topping stuff then anything else.  Tomatos, cucumbers. carrots, celery....weird (but healthy) selection.  I was hoping for more variety there.  The staff here was friendly and helpful, I will give them that.  Place looks like it might have been an old fast food joint at one point?  I guess Im just not overall impressed, and had better experiences with Mongolian style cooking.  Sadly, this was not one of them.  :-(

1u2GVt4F8HB87TzbT9nMUA.text: Way better then any of the other locations. The guy in there was super helpful with everyone. There's not much standing room when it gets busy but the food is amazing.

GgRpoZbwVX-VmUsZFL_EzA.text: I'm always on the lookout for places where I can grab a healthy meal to go. Have been very impressed with YC's since I started going to it a couple of weeks back.   First off, love the concept. You get a bowl and you can pile it high with various meats, veggies, noodles, and rice. You pick a sauce and then hand everything over to one of the chefs who cooks it right there in front of you. You also get a soup, won tons, and a drink, all for $11-12. It's a good deal. I usually grab some brown rice, white meat chicken, a ton of veggies, and top it with some curry sauce for a very healthy, satisfying meal.  The cashiers and chefs are always extremely friendly. The first time I was in, two servers walked me through the whole process. Just very nice people and it's always consistent every time I go.  Overall, kudos to the owners as they really know how to run a business. I've also been to the Elliot Road location and it's the exact same experience.

rLs_xCCa_EEiZOlgw-NP8Q.text: My sister and I wanted to try something new but we were very unsure what we were wanting so we thought we'd go with the whole Mongolian "let's see them cook in front of us" place. I yelped here and there and noticed this place has extensive reviews. 4 stars with lots of reviews is hard to come by now days.   We walk in and we bypass the register so the lady immediately followed us and asked if it were our first time (clearly).  They have an option of bowls but there is only a dollar difference between small and large (we went with large).   You start by selecting the food you want from a small bar with numerous amounts of meats and vegetables. After that you get to pick your own seasonings that'll highlight your dish. The person at the register helps you with all of these options and is really helpful. After all your desires have been chosen you get to see the cook, cook your meal in front of you.   Along with the meal you get to pick up rice and soup with a drink (if you have gotten the meal). Which is a pretty sweet deal. After  our meal (which we didn't finish) we asked for to-go boxes which you have to pay fifty cents extra but with this being our first time she let us have them for free.   Overall experience was amazing. We definitely will be coming back but with empty stomachs. ;)

sIoWvLtu25hgwbJRYw_DEw.text: I love YC's! Best place for a huge meal with tons of tasty leftovers. The place is clean and the hostess, while sometimes takes a while to get to the front, is always polite. The food is DELICIOUS and the fact that they give you recipes for the sauces is cool. My food always comes out amazing and the cherry on top is that even though it's not a full sit down restaurant, the hostess still checks on you to make sure your meal is fine.  **just something to mention: the cost for a doggy bag last time I was in was a mere $.50 plus tax and to pay that to have a great lunch the next day is so worth it for sure.

QxEVwbZFFqRixttt3mxqjg.text: My wife and I ate here to night with friends. I thought it was good, my wife did not. This is a place where you get a bowl to add all the raw items you want to have cooked on a very large flat stone surface. Then you add sauces for from a large variety to a separate bowl to add to your raw items when cooked. They have suggestions but you don't have to follow this. I created my own and I was sure to dip my finger in my sauce bowl to check the state. Be sure to do this as the sauce needs to be pretty strong because a lot of it will be lost when it is cooked on the flat stone. My wife failed to do this and hers turned out to be not very flavorful. Overall it was good for me and I would come back. It would be especially good for gluten free eating or low carb as everything is clearly marked GF or not and most of the items are low carb.

vwf9et6O_Aa1IINJ_F-qzQ.text: Delicious, cheap (for how much you actually get), and oh yeah, delicious.  I LOVE this place. I easily take home enough food for 3 meals. Great variety and nice people.

J6ZxYQVnm8Zw6eEhaZAwxw.text: Great food as always, real courteous staff. The equipment is lacking in that there are jams in the ice machine, low on a couple of the soft drink syrups. The asian chips are more greasey the normal.

eIFXkrGmNQynFoOJ0l9Iwg.text: I revisited this location recently as a comp from the manager and, it was a wonderful experience.  The (assuming newer) manager runs a tight ship at this location, and it shows.  Patrons were much more well behaved than last time and the service was more friendly than I remember as well.  I LOVE Mongolian food but unfortunately any time I crave it I have to treck from the West side of town to the land of great Mongolian restaurants, which is the East Valley.    Normally, I go to the location on the 101 and Indian Bend, but my fiance and I decided that we liked this location much better after our visit as it has a more laid back calmer atmosphere.  Everything was clean and organized.  I avoided the fish altogether this time, and opted for steak/chicken.  The veggie variety was amazing and they have sriracha available as well.  Sriracha is my new found LOVE, and any place that offers it, is A-OK with me.  All in all, I will definitely return, and thank the manager for making me a believer and a HUGE fan of this location of YC's Mongolian Grill.

Ga6M76qQ3605A8SKuriwYA.text: Over all a great experience. Quality and quantity is though to beat. We all needs take away boxes. Food was good. If you haven't done this kind of food prep (Mongolian BBQ.) look one up near you. I would come back and will look another in the next town I visit.

W7AbHIOfRjLVIeInhxEQBw.text: By far some of the best customer service around. The employees are super accommodating in making sure you don't have any questions while in line. They help with making sauces and were genuinely caring people.  Not to mention the food was awesome and lasted for about 2 whole meals after- would definitely recommend and awesome customer service!

-UPJuQeIaevSj0LA7GRNNg.text: One of my favorite's for over twenty years, they gotta be doing something right. It's a Tempe institution.

GErRpYkfGq5KGcM7fb0V-Q.text: WOW! Food was so good! And you get so much! And extra free sides! What a hook up! Staff is SO nice & friendly too!! Definitely coming back here!!

XTb_HT9wDQhTx9D2mRZVzg.text: I've been eating at YC's for years.  They've had consistently good prices, with a good selection of meats, vegetables, and sauces to choose from.  They also offer 2 different types of noodles, along with white and brown rice to go with your custom stir fry meal.  There are also usually two soups of the day to choose from, made with the previous night's leftovers it looks like.  They also have dessert in the form of soft serve!  For those that don't trust their own sauce-making skills, there are helpful recipes on the board above you for you to choose from.    Their dinner used to be all-you-can-eat at one price, but now they have a single bowl price and an all-you-can eat price.  Generally, I can only eat one bowl, so I usually go for the single trip!  If you can't finish your bowl, take out boxes are $.50 each.

4r3jBKKZ2J6izv94b4mX-Q.text: Super friendly staff. Delicious food. Good atmosphere (mood lighting).  They encourage you to pile your bowl as high as you want which is awesome as you have two meals worth of leftovers. Make sure that you add plenty of sauce to your food otherwise it may taste a little bland (especially if you pile it super high like I do). I recommend at least ten scoops of sauce for a super full bowl. They also have soup, rice, won tons and fountain drinks included with the price. This place is definitely a great value and is delicious to boot. Highly recommended.

7TFQqkJ5pO_YaVWKPoxXiA.text: Yet again, you guys amaze me and my partner with your wonderful service and food. Thanks for helping speed up the line with helping others with getting their plates mixed and keeping the toppings stocked. Again thank you we will be back more and more.

IXNyGNys5tGrZJYSGCO8ZQ.text: First time here and the whole experience wow'd us. I have never had better customer service in a restaurant.  They were so helpful and friendly. The food is so good! I had the Chefs Favorite sauce and it was very flavorful. Even though we live in Avondale, we will be back. Hope to see one open in the west valley!

-cu-s-Bi5dGjVVzCuZ3muQ.text: Awesome.  Been going there for years.  I love that they have sauce recipes to help you.  They have tons of parking.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

-TyRZE9aQ1DFtqgOX2KaLg.text: The food bar was clean at this location, items were well stocked and staff was extremely friendly. The grill/cook catered to requests and offered tips that helped make the experience better than my last.  I came to this YC's , as I had a bad experience at another location on two occasions. The grill specialist did not water down my bowl ( he added my oils/sauces AFTER water was applied to the grill).  THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT as it preserves the quality and taste of your bowl (make this recommendation when you visit)   Inspect the laddles/spatulas handles before you touch them , as other patrons are not sanitary. This is NOT YC's fault.  This location was constantly walking around, cleaning and stocking items.   TIP:  Place your oils/sauces in a SEPARATE BOWL.  Don't let the cook at the grill add a lot of water to your food .  Request that the water is added BEFORE adding your oils/sauces.   The overall experience was enjoyable and I would recommend the YC's chain again. Thank you to the owners/management for correcting a previous experience.

5NMsO82H-ROOtgez3SE16Q.text: This is a favorite.  You get to pick the meat you like, then the vegetables then the sauce to top it off. It is a culinary adventure every time.  Delicious!

lSbZOtlGXA7BGqZgj3N41A.text: So far is the best mongolian grill ive been too.  maybe cuz is the first official mongolian grill ive been to. ive been to buffets that have a grill in the back but is not the same.  This one was diff and more delicious. Ive been here a couple of times and let me tell u is really good. i like the fact that u can make ur own sauce. Also i like that u can take ur left overs and eat them later.

Z5-Q1roH-kzbT-hNM4gO-g.text: The food at YC's is always great. I think they are very affordable considering they cook whatever you can pack into a bowl plus a drink, soup, and rice. I've noticed the cooks at this location are less than stellar though. The one on Elliott is better, though this one is good too.

photos.caption: Photo of YC's Mongolian Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Udon noodles with chicken, beef, broccoli, corn, and water chestnuts with YC&#39;s Own sauce

VtCWCozVtM2UVjVWVqRnUQ.text: I am a huge fan of YC's Mongolian BBQ and usually go to the Chandler/Gilbert locations. My husband and our two kids came here on Father's day 2016 due to the proximity to where we were shopping at the time. I immediately noticed that this building was in serious need of some work. The back section looked like it was falling apart and frankly, was pretty gross to look out the dingy faded windows. The customer service was very poor, employees looked like they didn't want to be there, nobody was pleasant, and it was contagious. Usually when I go to the other locations I can taste the flavor of the sauce that I made in my food, in this case, all of our food tasted the same, regardless of which sauce recipe we used. It was a pretty depressing experience and I do not plan on going back to this location.

gQY52RzlTah1ynwkFXsraw.text: Solid Mongolian grill.  Pretty standard.  Get your bowl, pack it with meat, veggies and noodles then make a sauce from one of the recipes on the board or go kamikaze and create your own sauce.  I always try the latter option hoping to discover some amazing combination that hasn't been thought of.  It seems pretty hard to mess it up though.  Depending on what you choose its going to come out one of 2 ways.. spicy or not spicy.  I don't really like being forced to buy a drink with the bowl price, but overall a good lunch.

bQM4NT-Ix6fp1TaIp-LdXA.text: Gross. Filthy. In dire need of remodel. All utensils, dining surfaces, fixtures, trays, etc are in need of replacement.  The ignorant, un-enthused staff member did not fully explain the choices available as she handed us dingy steel bowls, and charged about $12.00 a person for them. . I also was WAY NOT COOL with what seemed like gallons of water being added to my meal as it was cooked on the grill, ultimately creating a disgusting soupy mess of a dinner.  I was not interested in finishing my meal, and HAD TO PAY OUT OF POCKET FOR A TO-GO CONTAINER AND A BAG.  Finally, when it comes to the soup... Do not, for your life, eat this trash. It's days old meats and veggie bits... So rancid. So gross. If you look at my other reviews, I tend to focus on the positive aspects of my dining experiences, but unfortunately the negatives at YC's Mongolian Grill were many.  I highly suggest NOT eating here.

ctWy_ENHqNMSalWB4_iCVg.text: I went last night at 8:30pm and the doors were CLOSED!  I just wanted food to go:( why couldn't they attended me!?   That's a waste of business, closing a half an hour before actual closing time? Really guys?? I had to go to subway, I guess it's good business for subway:p    Maybe complaining to the manager might be good, I LOVE THIS PLACE, but why close at 8:30pm when the sign says 9:00pm?   The food is great and all I've been coming here for the past 2years, but my one star goes to closing WAAAYYYYYY to early.  What a disappointment!  What's the point of going after work for dinner if it closes WAY before closing time?:(  Thanks for not wanting to attend me, I'll be choosing other places to eat.  It would of been 5 stars:(

WmBzwmxjS_K2NnXOMvuVyA.text: The food is typical of any YC's Mongolian Grill, but the reason why I'm writing this review is because of the great service at this location.  There is a staff member (server? not sure what to call her) named Janet that is just so helpful. While you're in line making your bowl, she'll ask you if you'd like a sauce prepared, she'll recommend sauces for your taste, etc.  She helps you bring things to your table, and checks in on you during the meal. Awesome service!

hOZ9eymZPb-Oq2O1_ga37A.text: This one is fine. Good food, service, clean restaurant. What sucks about it is the customers that frequent this place. Super irritating. I'd go do a different location if I were you.

T9K8RHDtwy3dJWEHyt-OHQ.text: If you know how to cook, you should have a good time at YC's. Your meal is basically what you make of it, and although the bowl may be on the medium side, you will shortly find that this makes for a huge meal. I could not even finish mine and had leftovers to take home. They encourage you to pile it as high as you can get it, then I added two bowls of sauce, one spicy and one Mongolian and it came out great. Perfectly sauced, and not thin and soupy like some have stated.   The only thing I didn't really like was the frozen fish, it just did not work well with the stir fry. Bonus if you are tired of take-out consisting of mostly bell pepper pieces and not enough meat, you can make your whole bowl consist of meat, sauce, and rice! (Not that I condone such behaviour).  I thought the ice cream was going to be an icy afterthought like most buffets, but it was actually pretty good so I had two like a big pig. I wouldn't call it gourmet but I would call it decent takeout quality.

MMlYTOwwaUO7GBl_Xpv_Jg.text: Love love love this place such a variety of fresh vegetables and protein, . The sauces are flavorful and there is more than one for every palette. Great soup too!
